intro: Colladonia crenata, commonly known as the crested lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, crested inflorescence. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value and unique appearance make it a sought-after addition to botanical collections.
